intro: Scabiosa capillata, commonly known as the "pincushion flower," is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its fluffy, spherical flower heads composed of numerous small, pink or white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and produces clusters of tiny, hairy florets that resemble a pincushion. Scabiosa capillata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
